title: Developing New Managers
headline: Learn how to build effective development strategies and leadership skills for new managers in this free online course.
description: Does your organisation have a roadmap for employees who want to move into managerial positions? If such a roadmap exists, do employees know how to access it? In today’s digitised global world, high-quality management is crucial to organisational success. This free online course will help you learn how to meet the development needs of first-time managers by building competencies through effective management development strategies. Enrol today.

courseDescription:
The critical function of the manager is to achieve the organisational vision by translating leadership and shareholder objectives into legal and practical actions. No matter your industry, your organisation needs to have skilled managers in the right place to reach its potential. However, managers don’t just materialise, equipped with the skills they need to succeed. Managers need to be taught and developed. Building a process for the support and development of new managers will ensure the success of your organisation in its entirety.

In this course, we will show you the traits of effective managers. Discover why adequate high-quality management is the key to organisational success. Learn why you should develop a management track that outlines the skills, experiences and developments needed to qualify for management positions. We will explain why and how you can create a list of competencies that first-level managers need to become highly successful in whatever roles they assume.

Furthermore, we will introduce practical tools for developing new managers. You will see why it is crucial to identify the development needs and provide expansion opportunities for new managers. By taking this online course, you will learn to guide first-time managers to develop their leadership skills and ensure they become efficient professionals and succeed in their new roles. Start learning today!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about management strategies, including the development plan for new managers. We will highlight the traits of effective managers and the info for creating a management track that will enhance the development of employees with management potentials to aid their growth opportunities.

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Identify the strategies, processes and tools that can help develop first-time managers 
    • Recognize the skill demand for successful transitioning of employees into managerial roles 
    • Identify the traits of effective managers 
    • Outline the core competencies used in evaluations and professional development plans of managers 
    • Explain the importance of mentorship and reward in developing quality first-time managers 
    • State the advantages of succession planning and change management in organizational leadership

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
    Several strategies can help you develop new managers and ensure the success of the employees and the organization as a whole.
  • 1.   Managers are Made, Not Born - Perhaps the most crucial part of developing new managers is giving them the opportunities to develop management skills, empowering them to take charge of their professional development, and creating chances to apply what they learned.
  • 1.1 Managers must be developed - While some skills may come more easily to some people than others, managers must be developed.
    1.2  Management Skills can be Learned - Emphasizing that skills are learned, not automatic or inborn, is crucial when developing managers.
  • 1.3  Managers Learn by Being Managed Well - Some traits of effective managers include:
    ● Responsiveness    ● Investment in employee development    ●  Holding themself/employees to a high standard 
    ● Personal accountability                            ● Speaking clearly and politely to colleagues, customers and clients
  • 1.4  Create management Track - When creating a management track, include vital information such as:
    ● The key competencies needed for management   ● The average expected years of work experience for managers
    ● Potential paths towards management through other positions       ● The education requirements of managers
